answers.answer: I agree with the testing done so far.To address your questions:1) The MRI results would make MS less likely.  If MS continues to be a concern, a lumbar puncture can be considered for further evaluation.2) The course of MS is variable, and there may be a relapsing course during pregnancy.3) I cannot give a definitive diagnosis without evaluation.   A neurological condition continues to be possible.  Nerve conduction studies can be considered to look for peripheral neuropathy, which can cause pins and needles and other paresthesias.4) I would consider the nerve conduction studies as the next step.  Blood tests to evaluate for B12 deficiency, thyroid deficiency and diabetes should also be considered.5) I cannot answer the question regarding pregnancy without knowing the exact cause of your symptoms.Another neurological opinion can be considered if the diagnosis remains elusive.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.kevinmd_

question: My symptoms started May 2006 when I got hit in the head with a medicine ball, a few days later I started to get tingling all over my body and became real weak, I went to many docs at this time which they all said it was anxiety, since my wedding was right around the corner too.  Neuro did an mri w/o contrast that was normal of the brain and the one of the c-spine showed 3 bulging disks, I went to the chiro for this.  About 2 months later this strange feelings I was having were gone.  Feb 2007, I started to get real bad, these were all my symptoms that I got, weakness in arms and legs, headaches, twitching, itching, floaters, eye pain, sensitivity to light, face pain, burning sensations, hot and cold sensations in feet, pins and needles, muscle jerking at night, lump in throat when swalloing, thick speech, back and neck pain, numbess that only occurs at night but feeling returns right when I shake if off.  Neuro again did mri w/o contrast and it was normal.  All blood work was normal, rheumy said no fibro, again they said anxiety.  Soon after most symptoms were gone again, but a few of them are back now again and I am 9 weeks pregnant.  I am seeing a LLMD who is running all tests for lyme and some other viruses too.  I have this burning, aching feeling in my arms and legs that just wont go away and it came right when I got pregnant.These are my questionsMy neuro has ruled out ms on many occasions, but sometimes I am very suspicious of it.If it was ms woulnd't symptoms go into remission when pregnant?From your expertise what could possibly be causing all this?If my lyme test comes negative, where should I turn next?Being pregnant does this put my child at risk?In the last year this is the 3rd time that symptoms have gone and came and I am just scared that it will happen again, I know something is causing this.Thank You!
title: Need some adive please.....
